title: Virtual World-Based First Language Learning Design Workshop for Special Education Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic special education theory and understanding of language development stages
context.additional_context: A course for science field professionals to learn VR environment design methods that support first-language acquisition for special education learners. Participants engage in hands-on practice, constructing virtual world scenarios and developing assessment tools.

learning_goals: Learners can explain six HCI design principles for promoting language development of special education learners in virtual world environments
Learners can design learning scenarios for vocabulary and sentence structure acquisition of special education learners using VR/simulation tools
Learners can develop a metrics framework to measure the effectiveness of virtual learning environments based on formative assessment
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
